intro: Pentace eximia, commonly known as the African star gooseberry, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, yellowish seeds.
